main event: On 27 April 1952, four persons in Roseville, Michigan, observed four unconventional aircraft making rapid maneuvers in the sky.
interesting points: The objects appeared silvery and varied in shape, including round, oval, and cigar-shaped., The objects were visible for about 15 minutes and changed shapes during the sighting., Observers reported that the objects dropped straight down before stopping., Another observer described a shiny circular object about thirty feet in diameter with a pronounced glow., Multiple witnesses reported seeing the objects, and they did not conform to any known type of aircraft.
witness description: Various individuals, including Mr. Roland J. Miller, observed the objects with the naked eye and binoculars.
